captions.text: What’s up you fucking meat-cigar smokers? The album is back with group D, the group of death
Uruguay
Uruguay is a small South American country right down south Brazil.
They drink “matte” tea down there all day and know how to cook a hell of a barbecue,
but are much more awesome than Argentinians, and much more macho than “gauchos”.
Uruguay has a chill president, who liberated pot for his people.
#letsmovetouruguay
In soccer, Uruguay are twice world champions
Meaning they don’t owe anything to Argentinians, pelotudos de mierda, hijos de una gran puta.
The biggest accomplishment of the Uruguayan squad is to have won against Brazil in the 1950 finals in Maracanã.
Nevertheless, after that Uruguay never won shit.
The highlights of the Celestial are:
the defender Lugano, who is such a horse that doesn’t wear boots, he wears horseshoes.
And their attacking duo: buck toothed Luisito Suárez,
who with the Liverpool jersey looks just like Monica and with the Uruguayan jersey like the bunny Sansão.
And el matador Cavani, who has women’s hair and looks like the Brazilian singer Céu.
Costa Rica
Costa Rica may be rich in name, but it’s poor in soccer.
This Central American country is a cool touristic destiny for lovers of beach, surf and nature.
Meaning, the reggae-listening pot-smoking bums.
Costa Rica had a female President, Laura Chinchilla. That’s right, Chinchilla.
She’s just like the Brazilian president Dilma, but has long hair and actually looks like a woman.
In the 2002 World Cup, Brazil won 5x2 against Costa Rica.
Costa Rica managed to get scored on with a half bicycle kick from the defender Edmílson.
And Brazil had the gall to get scored on twice by shitty Costa Rica.
Congratulations to all involved.
Let’s find out who are the Costa Rican highlights, if that even exists.
Costa Rica is so lame that their coach is Pinto (dick).
And for Pinto not to fall after the Cup he called the Levante goalkeeper.
Keylor Navas is the name of the best goalkeeper of the Spanish tournament.
The other highlight is the neck of the forward Bryan Ruiz. Mother of God, what a fucking giraffe.
He gets the prize for biggest Adam’s apple of the Cup.
England
England is a country in the UK where soccer was born.
But thank God football ran away to Brazil, because the British squad only won the Cup once,
in 66, while hosting, with a stolen goal at the end.
Besides the wrench, Worcestershire sauce, a lot of drug addict musicians,
bad food and rotten teeth, England is known for being the land of Mr. Bean, British Didi Mocó,
without getting all the money from charity.
This year, England closed a deal with its new sports suppliers, Hering Store.
That’s why everybody is wearing a plain white jersey in the stickers.
So let’s hear the highlights of the British squad:
I’m sorry to interrupt, but England is nothing without that monument of a man David Beckham.
Shut up, biatch.
The highlights are the midfield duo from the time when the queen was a nymphet, Gerrard and Lampard.
The vocalist of Oasis, Noel Gallagher.
And the forwards Welbeck Fresh Prince of Bel Air and Roony Shrek.
It’s worth remembering that the defender John Terry, also known as “adulterry”,
was taken off the list because he fucked the coach’s wife.
Italy
Italy is that European country full of mafia and debauchery, since the time of the roman emperor Caligula,
until the modern days of Berlusconi, that fucking naughty old man.
They even get kinky in that little country inside Rome known as the Vatican,
where some nasty priests teach the altar boys how to ring the bells.
Even worse for the Vatican is that their ruler is an Argentine.
In Italy, the men think they’re so hot that they become metrosexual.
Even the genius Leonardo Da Vinci was a queer.
Other than slurping spaghetti until their faces are all covered in tomato sauce, Italians love sucking some bracciola.
They all have their eyebrows plucked, underwear from Gucci and Armani suits.
What fucking faggot stuff. Vaffanculo!
Italy is shaped like a boot that matches their inelegant style of play, which has won them 4 Cups.
The current squad is practically Juventus, without Carlitos Tevez and Arturito Vidal.
Let’s go to the highlights of the Azurra, Mamma Mia!
The three tenors of the retirement home, Buffon Domingo
De Rossi Carreras e Pirlo Pavarotti.
As well as the striker niggar drama, Vera Verão from Milan, Mario Balotelli.
That’s all for now folks. But you already know:
next week there’s Switzerland, Ecuador, France e Honduras, because the fun never ends.
SUBSCRIBE

title: ÁLBUM DA COPA DO DESIMPEDIDOS - #04 GRUPO D
